Package com.google.inject.tools.suite.snippets

The code snippets that must be run in the user's workspace to resolve guice bindings etc.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
BindingCodeLocation Represents the location in code of where a binding occurs.
BindingCodeLocation.NoBindingLocation Represents the lack of a binding.
CodeLocation Represents a location in the user's code space.
CodeProblem Represents a problem found involving the user's guice code, such as a CreationException.
CodeProblem.BadClassProblem Represents a problem in code that a class referenced is not useable.
CodeProblem.BindingProblem Represents a problem with the binding of the class being injected.
CodeProblem.CreationProblem Represents a CreationException problem.
CodeProblem.InvalidModuleContextProblem Represents a problem that the module context is invalid.
CodeProblem.InvalidModuleProblem A code problem that a module specified is invalid.
CodeProblem.NoBindingProblem Represents that no binding is defined for the class being injected.
CodeProblem.OutOfScopeProblem Represents an OutOfScopeException during injection.
CodeSnippet A CodeSnippet is a piece of code to be executed by the CodeRunner in user space.
CodeSnippetResult Abstract object holding the result of running a CodeSnippet.
ModuleContextSnippet This code snippet runs a module context.
ModuleContextSnippet.ModuleContextResult The result of a module context snippet, containing all the information about the context.
ModuleContextSnippet.ModuleContextResult.KeyRepresentation  
ModuleContextSnippet.ModuleRepresentation Represents a module in this context internally.
ModuleSnippet<T extends Module> A code snippet for running a module to find its constructor information and validity.
ModuleSnippet.ConstructorRepresentation Representation of a constructor for a module.
ModuleSnippet.DefaultConstructorRepresentation Represents a default constructor for a module.
ModuleSnippet.ModuleResult The result of a module snippet run.
 

Package com.google.inject.tools.suite.snippets Description

The code snippets that must be run in the user's workspace to resolve guice bindings etc.

The snippets package will be compiled and shipped as a standalone .jar file in addition to being part of the main project. The snippets.jar will be used to run code in userspace by the CodeRunner. Essentially the user's code and the snippets.jar file will be placed in the classpath of a newly launched java vm which will then run a snippet to determine how the user's modules behave.
